Title:
A new endophytic species of Arthrinium (Apiosporaceae) from
Jatropha podagrica
Keywords:
Hyphomycetes  India ITS  lenticular conidia  Phylogeny 
Taxonomy
Abstract:
During study of endophytic fungal diversity in tropical
region, a new species of Arthrinium was isolated from healthy petiole of
Jatropha podagrica. The fungus is characterized by aseptate, dark brown,
circular lenticular conidia with hyaline margin (some are deformed);
broad, hyaline conidiophores with numerous brown septa and ampulliform
to lageniform conidiogenous mother cells. The new species superficially
resembles A. phaeospermum and A. saccharicola in having circular
lenticular conidia, but differs in the size of its conidia, conidiophore
morphology, size and conidiogenous cells. Phylogenetic study using
sequence analysis of ITS region (ITS1-5.8S-ITS2) separates thenew
species (A. jatrophiae) from other related species of Arthrinium.
